main event: A UFO sighting was reported in Mexico, Maine on December 21, 1956. The sighting involved a bright, glaring green object that descended over a period of almost two weeks.
interesting points: Senator Margaret Chase Smith forwarded the report to the USAF, indicating high-level attention to the sighting.
The source, a housewife, described the object as round, the size of a washing machine cover, with a single light that appeared to be turning on and off.
Investigative action had been initiated, with results intended to be made known to the Central Intelligence Agency upon completion.
Preliminary analysis indicated that the sighting may have been caused by light reflections or auto headlights reflecting on windows or doors.
The report also mentioned a peculiar aspect of the sighting receiving considerable press coverage, hinting at public interest and concern.
sighted object: a bright, glaring green object descending over Mexico, Maine
witnesses: Housewife and Senator Margaret Chase Smith
photographs: No, the report does not indicate the presence of photographs
